intro: Rhynchanthus papuanus, commonly known as the Papuan rhynchanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific islands, particularly New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
